title: 'Godzilla vs Kong' trailer gives first glimpse of epic monster showdown
description: Hollywood has rocked the internet with a glimpse of a monster new offering -- "Godzilla vs Kong."

title: The strange but true reason why GameStop's stock keeps surging
description: GameStop is expected to lose money this year and next year. Sales growth is sluggish as fewer gamers need to go to stores -- or even shop online -- when they can download new titles directly from their consoles, PCs, phones or tablets.  So why are shares of the video game retailer up more than 425% so far in 2021, including a 60% surge Monday?

title: Facebook suspends chatbot linked to Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu
description: Facebook has deleted a post by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and suspended a chatbot linked to his account for violating the company's privacy policy.

title: Senate's longest-serving Democrat, not Chief Justice Roberts, to preside over Trump impeachment trial
Here are the executive orders Biden has signed so far
description:
• Biden lifts Trump's transgender military ban
• LIVE UPDATES Biden expected to sign another order later today
• Covid-19 relief could hit a big roadblock

title: Biden lifts Trump-era transgender military ban
description: President Joe Biden signed an executive order to repeal a Trump-era ban on most transgender Americans joining the military on Monday alongside Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin.

title: 'Bridgerton' viewers spot a historical mistake in scenes
description: Oh, dear. How ever could they have missed this during their promenade around the town square?

title: As the House readies to send over the article to the Senate, the contours of Trump's second trial are starting to take shape
description: The contours of former President Donald Trump's second impeachment trial are starting to take shape, with the Senate's longest-serving Democrat expected to preside over the trial.

title: Apple issues new warning about iPhones and pacemakers
description: An important heads-up for iPhone owners: Apple is warning customers that its smartphones could interfere with medical devices, including pacemakers.

title: Legal analyst: Dominion's case looks pretty strong
description: Dominion Voting Systems has sued former President Donald Trump's personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani for defamation after he pushed claims of election fraud against the company. CNN's Elie Honig breaks down the case.

title: TikTok rival's IPO could be the biggest since the pandemic began
description: A short-form video app that competes with the Chinese version of TikTok is preparing for what is expected to be the world's largest initial public offering since the coronavirus pandemic began.

title: Xi pushes global cooperation: 'Arrogant isolation will always fail'
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping has called for a return to multilateralism, with leaders working together to put the global economy back on track, in his first speech since his US counterpart, Joe Biden, took office.

title: Justice Department watchdog investigating possible attempt to overturn election results
description: The Justice Department's internal watchdog will investigate whether any department official sought to have the department overturn President Joe Biden's election win.

title: White House staff welcomes new first family: 'The residence has life again'
Moderna says its Covid-19 vaccine is expected to be protective against new variants
Republicans just took 2 big hits to their chances to reclaim the Senate in 2022
description: Just days into their newfound status as the minority party, Senate Republicans suffered two body blows that could badly complicate their chances of retaking control in 2022.

title: Dominion sues Giuliani for $1.3 billion over falsehoods about election fraud
description: Dominion Voting Systems has sued former President Donald Trump's personal lawyer Rudy Giuliani for defamation after he pushed the "Big Lie" about election fraud on his podcast and TV appearances.

title: Concorde successor AS2 takes leap forward
description: Florida-based company Aerion breaks ground on a new production HQ for its 1,000mph AS2 private jet

title: Supreme Court dismisses emoluments cases against Trump
description: The Supreme Court declined on Monday to hear a case concerning whether former President Donald Trump violated provisions of the Constitution that bar a president from profiting from a foreign government.

title: Grim outlook in UK is a warning for the world
description:
• Moderna says its Covid-19 vaccine is expected to be protective against new variants
• LIVE Stocks sink on vaccine concerns

title: White House staff welcomes new first family: 'The residence has life again'
description:
• Analysis: Biden's authority already on the line
• LIVE UPDATES: Latest on Biden presidency and Trump impeachment trial

title: Keira Knightley won't act in sex scenes directed by men
description: According to Keira Knightley, she doesn't "have an absolute ban" on shooting nude scenes, but she's not comfortable doing so with male directors.

title: Lawmaker who asked racist question about Black hygiene tapped to lead Ohio health panel
description: A GOP Ohio lawmaker who asked a racist question last year about whether "the colored population" was contracting Covid-19 at higher rates because of poor hygiene has been tapped to lead the state Senate's health panel.

title: China flies warplanes close to Taiwan in early test of Biden
description: China dispatched two large formations of warplanes close to the self-governing island of Taiwan over the weekend, presenting a significant foreign policy challenge to new United States President Joe Biden just days into his administration.

title: 5 planets found in unusual rhythmic dance around a star 200 light-years away
description: Astronomers have discovered a planetary system including six planets and it's not quite like anything they've seen before. The system could challenge the theories scientists have about how planets form and change over time.

title: Analysis: Rand Paul can't say election was not stolen
description: Even now -- after the inauguration of Joe Biden as the 46th president, after the January 6 riot at the US Capitol, after the myriad lawsuit dismissals -- Rand Paul can't bring himself to say that the 2020 election was not, in fact, stolen.

title: Grandparents die of Covid-19 while holding hands
description: Childhood sweethearts Dick Meek, 89, and Shirley Meek, 87, passed minutes apart from Covid-19, three days before they were scheduled to receive the coronavirus vaccine. Their grandchildren tell CNN's Alisyn Camerota more.

title: Gymnast earns praise for her 'Black excellence' routine
description: The reviews are in for gymnast Nia Dennis' "Black excellence" floor routine and they're nothing short of sensational.

title: Song Yoo-jung, South Korean TV star, dead at 26
description: South Korean actress Song Yoo-jung has died at the age of 26, her agency confirmed Monday.

title: This restaurant's menu offers bluntly honest descriptions of its dishes
description: Feigang Fei, owner of Cuisine AuntDai in Montreal, wants to be honest with you.

title: Nick Kyrgios embraces role as moral voice on Covid-19
description: With the Australian Open set to start in just two weeks, local hero Nick Krygios has told CNN that he has embraced his role of holding fellow pros accountable including top-ranked Novak Djokovic during the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Dave Chappelle photo-bombed a couple's 'first look' wedding photos
description: "First look" photos have long been a memorable moment for couples on their wedding day. The tradition allows the photographer to capture the look on the love birds' faces as they see each other all dressed up for the first time.

title: What it's like to be a lighthouse keeper
description: Caroline Woodward wakes each morning to the sound of waves crashing onto the rocks that surround her home, tiny Lennard Island, at the head of Clayoquot Sound near Tofino, British Columbia Canada.

title: Budweiser is skipping the Super Bowl for the first time in nearly four decades
description: Budweiser's Clydesdale horses have become synonymous with the Super Bowl. But this year, they're getting a rest: For the first time in 37 years, the beer company isn't advertising during the Super Bowl.

title: Fauci and Birx tell interviewers about the 'nonsense' of the Trump years
description: A version of this article first appeared in the "Reliable Sources" newsletter. You can sign up for free right here.

title: Fossilized skull reveals how crested dinosaur got its fancy headgear
description: First discovered in 1922 and best known for its distinctive crest, Parasaurolophus is one of the most recognizable dinosaurs -- a staple of childhood books and a background player in the Jurassic Park movie franchise.

title: Man survives 18 days lost in Australian bush, eating mushrooms and drinking dam water
description: A man who was missing for two and a half weeks in the Australian bush has been found alive after surviving on mushrooms and dam water, police say.

title: Uganda court orders security forces to leave Bobi Wine's home
description: The Ugandan High Court has lifted the house arrest of Bobi Wine after security forces surrounded the presidential candidate's home for ten days, his lawyer said Monday.

title: The islands that only Chinese tourists can visit
description: They're known for clear aquamarine waters, stretches of soft beaches ... and political intrigue.

title: Pirates kidnap 15 sailors in attack on Turkish container ship off coast of Nigeria
description: Pirates off Nigeria's coast kidnapped 15 sailors from a Turkish container ship on Saturday, in a brazen and violent attack that was farther from shore than usual.

title: Meet New York's radical female and non-binary skateboarders
description: Jordana Bermúdez isn't a skateboarder, but she found a sense of community at a skate park on Manhattan's Lower East Side.

title: Swimming with manta rays could help save them
description: Around 5,000 manta rays swim in the warm waters of Maldives, where they are protected. Globally, the species faces multiple threats, though. Beth Faulkner of the Maldivian Manta Ray Project says that swimming in the wild with these gentle giants can help their survival: "The more people are aware of manta rays ... the more they're going to want to protect them."
